questions.question: Which piece of kit seems to be the issue?

power-board-function-checks.question: Choose the option that best describes your situation.

answers.answer: My Power Board isn't doing anything

answers.message: This means that the board's current limit has been triggered. Try connecting fewer things to the board, or change your code so that your motors turn on more slowly.

power-board-switch-check.question: Is the external On|Off switch connected?

answers.message: There is an external On|Off switch connector. If you are not connecting a switch, you must connect a loop of wire between the two terminals. See the preparation section in kit assembly for more details.

power-board-power-check.question: Is the battery plugged in and charged?

answers.message: Check the ‘Charging Batteries’ section of the battery documentation and try again. Make sure to follow the instructions appropriate for the charger you have been supplied with.

battery-damage-check.question: Does the battery have any bulges in it?

answers.message: You should immediately disconnect the battery, place it in a dry container — preferably outside — and post a message on the forums to discuss how to dispose of it.

is-battery-charged.question:
Are your batteries definitely charged up?
Try plugging them into your charger and waiting for 'battery full' sound.

answers.message: It is important that you keep your batteries charged so that they don't run down too low. Consult the documentation and make sure to follow the instructions appropriate for the charger you have been supplied with.

both-batteries.question: Try using your other battery. Does this fix the issue?

answers.message: There may be a problem with the specific battery, consider posting on the forums.
There may be a problem with your Power Board or Charger, consider posting on the forums.

io-board-function-check.question: Choose the option that best describes your situation.

answers.answer: My external peripherals aren't working as I expected.

io-board-led.question: Is the Power light on your Ruggeduino on?

io-board-power.question: Is the Ruggeduino connected to the USB hub?

answers.message: Connect the Ruggeduino to the Power Board as described in the Docs.

io-board-dead.question: Is there any apparent damage to your Ruggeduino (check the pins for visible deformation)?

answers.message: There is an issue with your Ruggeduino, you should post a message on the forums.
There may be an issue with your power connector, consider posting on the forums.

io-board-usb.question: Is the Ruggeduino connected to the Power Board via an appropriately connected USB Hub?

answers.message: You should connect up your Ruggeduino to the Power Board as described.

io-peripherals.question: There could be an issue with one of your external peripherals, please verify they are connected properly, and consider testing them independently.

answers.message:
You may well have mixed up an IO pin index in your code, remember they are zero-indexed — double check your pin indexing.
Make sure you are using the right pins for your type of output (digital or analouge) as per the docs.

If you continue to have difficulties then consider posting on the forums.

answers.answer: I need help with my peripherals
answers.message: Consider asking about this hardware on the forums, and check the manual or contact the manufacturer of your peripheral.

motor-board-function-check.question: Choose the option that best describes your situation.

answers.answer: My motors are not behaving the same as each other.
My motors are not doing what I expected

motor-force.question:
No two Motors are exactly the same, and the Pulse-Width Modulated nature of the power supply can lead to different behaviours from different motors, but there are some things we can check.
Is your battery charged? Less charge means lower voltage means less torque.

answers.message: Charge your batteries and try again. Make sure to follow the instructions appropriate for the charger you have been supplied with.

motor-count.question: Are you trying to control more than one motor at the same time?

motor-more-than-one.question: Select the option that best describes you situation.

answers.answer: Some of the Motors aren't spinning.
answers.message: You may well have mixed up a Motor index in your code — double check your Motor indexing.

answers.answer: Some of the Motors spin in the wrong direction
answers.message: Check the Motors are orientated correctly, and <abbr title="turn negative, ie: multiply by -1">negate</abbr> the values you pass to Motors if you notice it is spinning in the wrong direction.

answers.answer: The Motors are all spinning at different speeds
answers.message:
Double check your code for discrepancies, however, it is worth noting that no two Motors will give you exactly the same output, and you will need to account for this in your code.
Ensuring your batteries are charged will result in predictable operation, and allow you to cope with the issue.

motor-board-led.question: What colour is the the Power light on your Motor Board?

answers.message: The Motor Board's power connection is most likely back to front. Adjust the connection to the Power Board as described in the docs.

motor-board-power.question: Is the Motor Board connected to power?

answers.message: Connect the Motor to the Power Board as described in the docs.

motor-board-usb.question: Is the Motor Board connected with a USB to an appropriately connected USB Hub?

answers.message: Connect the Motor up with USB cables.

motor-programming-direction.question: Does the Motor spin in the wrong direction?

answers.message: Try giving a negative value to the Motor, as this will cause it to spin in the opposite direction.

motor-programming.question: Please test the Motor with the WiFi interface. Does the Motor respond to the interface?

answers.message: There may be an issue with your code, consider posting on the forums.
There may be an issue with your Motor Board, consider posting on the forums.

servo-board-function-check.question: Choose the option that best describes your situation.

answers.answer: The Servos aren't doing what I expected
answers.message: Check that the servo is orientated correctly as described in the docs, and check whether it is a continuous Servo.

servo-board-led.question: Is the Power light on your Servo Board on?

servo-board-power.question: Is the Servo Board connected to power?

answers.message: Connect the Servo to power as described in the Docs.

servo-board-usb.question: Is the Servo Board connected to the Power Board via an appropriately connected USB Hub?

answers.message: You should connect up your Servo Board to the Power Board as described.

servo-programming.question: Please test the Servo with the WiFi interface. Does the Servo respond to the robot interface?

answers.message: There may be an issue with your code, consider posting on the forums.
There may be an issue with your servo or Servo Board. Try using a different servo if you can, otherwise consider posting on the forums.

vision.question: Choose the option that best describes your situation.

answers.answer: The camera takes a long time to take a photo.
answers.message: The vision system always takes longer for the first photo. Consider taking a photo when your robot first starts.

vision-markers-dont-get-picked-up.question: Does the Webcam work if you plug it into a computer?

answers.message: There may be an issue with your Webcam, consider posting on the forums.

vision-markers-dont-get-picked-up-good-w.question: Is the marker ID listed in the rules as in use?

answers.message:
Make sure the marker is flat, well-lit and there a visible border around the pattern, and if your robot is moving you should check the camera is not shaking.
If you still cannot pickup any markers there could be a problem with your code, consider posting on the forums.
The robot will ignore marker IDs that are not in use for the game. Try using a marker that is listed in the rules.
